content: One of our biggest problems in onboarding is that the "All Messages" view is confusing. It's very tempting for new users to try it out, given its prominent position in the top left corner. I've submitted a PR to try to downplay it, but it's bit-rotted a bit.
One of the things that we would need to address if we lowered the link is the overall-unread-count.
I'm wondering if there's a way to show the overall unread count in an intuitive way that doesn't overly promote the "All messages link"?
Something like 99+?

That seems like a challenging problem because it feels pretty "correct" where it is right now, partly because it's in a good place, partly because you'd be used to it by now. I don't really see any other place where we could move it where it would immediately seem intuitively correct, but we could consider the following, (My opinion is, I think 1 makes the most sense. I'd be okay with 3. I'd be against something like 2.):
1. In between the "STREAMS" and the search,gear icons in the left sidebar.
2. Some where drastically different eg, top right corner, b/w the search and the gear icon.
3. No where. Rely on the bit in the browser tab.
I think the current plan is for "All unreads" to hold the unread count (and live in the top left spot)

I think the current plan is for "All unreads" to live in the top left spot

Oh, okay, I wasn't aware of that. In that case, I think what you're saying makes sense.
I think the 'all unread messages count' is not a meaningful value.
Especially with a high count of default streams.
There might be a case for aggregating similar information for all pinned streams though.

There might be a case for aggregating similar information for all pinned streams though.

This would definitely be an improvement
The only thing thatâ€™s valuable to me is seeing in one fixed place that I have some unread messages. The actual count rarely matters.
I agree, a lot of apps do this via a small blue circle.
I don't think even this circle makes sense for 'All messages' as the default case is that there will be unread messages.

There might be a case for aggregating similar information for all pinned streams though.

yeah, agreed. I think a natural first step will be to make the number in the favicon configurable in this way.
We do show a small circle in the favicon for whether there are unread pms or mentions.

I was wondering if we could make the "All messages view" a user level option that's turned off by default.

New users never see the All messages view, and by the time they go to settings and figure out there's an option to toggle it on, hopefully they'll be comfortable with the concept of streams and topics.

Experienced users who find it useful to have the chronological view of all messages, will turn it on, and use it.
We could make PMs the default home view.. :thinking:

We could make PMs the default home view.. :thinking:

The "All messages" view on the mobile app is pretty good imo. Short and sweet.
That's the Unreads view, and yes it's pretty nice! The All messages view is what you get by clicking on the globe icon.

The current plan is to make "All Unreads" the default view, and by default only really show "All messages" for users that are fully caught up.

But we did consider making "All messages" a user-level option, and it might be reasonable to revisit that as an interim solution.

It can really help new users, I think. A lot of new users on a realm I'm part of, get welcome messages when they join, and just end up replying on some other stream/topic, because there's another conversation going on there.
